Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.New-York Historical SocietyNew-York Historical Society170 Central Park WestNew York, NY 10024(212) 873-3400This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2022-04-29T17:46:59Description is in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard Documents in the collection are in English.
New-York Historical Society
Time Inc. Staff Organizations
Time, inc.
MS 3009-RG 18
11.5 Linear feet in 11 record cartons, 2 flat boxes
1940-2015 Time Inc. Staff Organizations contains records from clubs, sports, and other membership organizations involving only Time Inc. staff. The organizations include the Time Inc. Bowling League, Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW), and the Time-Life Alumni Society. Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
Scope and Contents Note
Time Inc. Staff Organizations contains records from clubs, sports, and other membership organizations involving only Time Inc. staff. These organizations were not necessarily sanctioned or overseen by Time Inc., but rather staff-driven. The organizations include the Time Inc. Bowling League, Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW), and the Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS).
Arrangement Note
Organized into three series:
Series I. Bowling League Records
Series II. Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW) Records
Series III. Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS) Collection
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers with the exception of restricted materials. Restricted materials include membership information in Series II. Restricted materials are located in boxes R14. Materials created within the past 35 years also may be subject to restriction on a case-by-case basis.
Unreformatted audiovisual and digital material in the collection is not accessible. Please contact the manuscripts curator to discuss access.
Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use.
Use Restrictions
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions.
Processing Information Note
Holly Deakyne created the collection-level descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.
Series I was processed by Deakyne in 2017. The original folders were retained when present although most documents were loose or in envelopes and required housing in archival folders. Physical arrangement was imposed. Deakyne created the inventory and other descriptive notes for this series.
Series II was processed by Melanie Rinehart in 2017. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Physical arrangement was imposed. Rinehart and Deakyne created the inventory and other descriptive notes for this series.
Series III was processed by Melanie Rinehart in 2018. The original folders were retained although some documents were transferred to archival containers in instances of overcrowding. Physical arrangement was imposed. Rinehart created the inventory and other descriptive notes for this series.
Related Archival Materials Note
This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.
Additional records on staff organizations including Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner are in the Time Inc. Reference Files (MS 3009-RG 3).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Time Inc. in 2015.
Preferred Citation
This record group should be cited as Time Inc. Staff Organizations, MS 3009-RG 18, New-York Historical Society.
Bowling Corporations -- History. Corporations -- New York (State) -- New York. Gay community -- New York (State) -- New York. Series I. Bowling League Records4.5 Linear feetin 3 record cartons, 2 flat boxes1961-1971, undated
Scope and Contents Note
The Bowling League Records document Time Inc.'s staff bowling league from 1961 to 1971. Based on the records, members in charge at various times were Bud Bliven, Carol-Ann Carpentieri, Joyce Christiansen, Loretta Geissler, Rod McDonald, Mary Piper, Val Pour, and Marian Powers. While teams list both men and women members, there are some records for the Woman's Bowling League from the same time period. Records include lists of participants; certifications and sanctions from the national bowling organizations; invitations and planning materials for league luncheons, awards banquets, and the 25th anniversary; newsletters and flyers; record books containing scores, statistics, and schedules; scorecards; registration sheets; photographic material; a scrapbook; a photograph album; and buttons. The "General" files may contain any of these materials. The newsletter was at one point called b.i.f., which was the motto "Bowling is Fun," and looks styled after the Time Inc. newsletter F.Y.I. The folder "Old Time Inc. Bowlers" includes lists of participants going back to the 1950s.
Arrangement Note
Organized chronologically by bowling season, then alphabetically by topic or record type. Scope and Contents Note
Photographs are of an event at Mamma Leone's.Photographs and Negativesundated78911Sketchesundated78912Series II. Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW) Records1 Linear feetin 2 record cartons1988-1997
Biographical/Historical Note
Lesbians and Gay Men at Time Warner (LGTW) was a staff grassroots organization at Time Warner from 1990 to 1995. Its goal was to be an "education and support group that addresses workplace issues affecting employees who are lesbian, gay, or bisexual". Later iterations of the group include Out@TimeWarner and Out@TimeInc.
Scope and Contents Note
Records include advocacy correspondence, meeting agenda, membership cards and contact lists, event planning materials, newsletters, memoranda, news clippings, and reference material. Membership lists and other materials naming members other than the Coordinating Committee are restricted since member confidentiality was assured by the group.
Arrangement Note
Organized chronologically by year, then alphabetically by topic or record type. Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS) Collection6 Linear feetin 6 record cartons1940-2015
Biographical / Historical
The Time-Life Alumni Society (TLAS) was founded in October 1977 by several retiring editors as a way to keep former Time Inc. employees connected to Time Inc. and each other after leaving the company. Receiving a small stipend by Time Inc. to print invitations and a newsletter, as well as office space, TLAS used member dues to fund several luncheons with guest speakers per year prior to 2018. Notable members include Dick Stolley, Norm Pearlstine, John Huey, Ralph Graves, and Maureen Dowd.
Scope and Contents
Materials include videocassettes, audiocassettes, photographs, member directories, memos, meeting minutes, newsletters, news clippings, and correspondence. These are records gathered by the Time Inc. Archives from TLAS and do not reflect TLAS's original organizational records.
Arrangement
Organized into five subseries:
Subseries III.A. President's Files
Subseries III.B. Newsletters and Membership Directories
Subseries III.C. Photographs
Subseries III.D. Audiovisual materials
Subseries III.E. GeneralSubseries III.A. President's Files1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1980-2005
Scope and Contents
Dick Stolley, whose materials from time as TLAS president are included, was an editor at various Time Inc. publications for over 40 years. His most notable moment was when he, as Life magazine editor, negotiated to purchase rights to the Zapruder film of the Kennedy assassination. Materials are dated from 2000 to 2005 and contain materials such as news clippings or personal letters from TLAS members, obituaries regarding past TLAS members, and internal correspondence or memos regarding TLAS activities.
Arrangement
Arranged in reverse chronological order.Directory of Members200527861Time-Life Alumni Society Miscellaneous2001-200427862-9Time-Life Alumni Society AOL Deal2001278610-11Time-Life Alumni Society Miscellaneous2000278612-14Luncheon Guests1980-200727871Carky Rubens Posterundated27872Subseries III.B. Newsletters And Membership Directories1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1979-2015
Scope and Contents
The member directories and newsletters range from 1979 to 2015. Newsletters also contain extra souvenir pamphlets from TLAS-sponsored parties or "Travels with TLAS".
Arrangement
Arranged alphabetically, then in reverse chronological order within each group.Membership Directories1978-201127873-7Newsletters1977-201527878-10Subseries III.C. Photographs1 Linear feetin 1 record carton1940-1988
Scope and Contents
Most of the photographs are of TLAS parties or "Travels with TLAS", which consisted of tours in locations such as Storm King, Paris, and Washington, D.C. One set of photographs, from the now-defunct 1940s employee group Time Out, is from Daniel and Mary Fraser Longwell's personal collection, sent to Marian McDermott in 1978; Daniel helped found Life magazine and was an editor for ten years, and Mary was a chief of research at Time (Prendergast and Colvin 449). Please note this Time Out group is not associated with the later LGBT staff organization.

Audiovisual materials [RESTRICTED]2 Linear feetin 2 record cartons1985-2001
Scope and Contents
Videocassettes are recordings of TLAS luncheon presentations and panels. Notable speakers include Hugh Sidey, Dick Stolley, Norm Pearlstine, and Martha Stewart.
The audiocassettes are recordings of TLAS luncheon presentations.
Unreformatted audiovisual material is not accessible.
